text:
Let's do steak.
Let's do some mashed potatoes.
Meat and potatoes?

Yeah, yeah, yeah, we grew up
eating this homestyle potato
where some were fried,

but we used a little bit
of fish sauce

with onions in it
and kind of mix it up.
Cool.
I don't know if Khoi should be

putting fish sauce
on his potatoes,

but I really want him to do
his thing.

Because if it's trash, then this
guy could possibly be the Rat.
Turn this off.

Too high, man.
Come on, man.

What even
is Salisbury steak?

Isn't that from,
like, the '70s?
Yes, it is.

I don't think
I've ever eaten it.

How you say the dish --
"Salber" steak?
Salisbury steak.
Salisbury steak.
Yes.
I love Salisbury steak.

[ Laughing ] You do?
I do.
I'm feeling like...

Can we do, like,
maybe a noodle?

And then I can make
a mean pound cake.

I love to bake.
My great aunt's recipe --

It is very near and dear to me.
There's nothing like it.

You bake. I'll cook.
Okay.

What's up, Jordan?
Hello, Chef.

[ Speaks French ]
Do you speak French?
I do not speak French.

Both kinds. Both kinds.
A little bit of both.

And you'll get the best
of both worlds.

With everything
in life.

Jordan's a little bit too bubbly
and kind of annoying.

So I feel like
it's all just an act.
I have the best partner.

What are you
doing, Shanel?

I'm getting ready to make
some pound-cake cupcakes.

Well, I really hope
you're not the Rat

because that sounds
delicious,

and I don't want you
to mess that up.

You'll just have
to wait and see.

Miranti!
Miranti: Yes.
Ca va?

I have no idea
what I'm doing,

so I'm just gonna try to do
some Indonesian magic

and see what happens.
Just put some flavor.

Water's almost boiling
for the potatoes.
Garlic is almost done.

Jordan: You don't put
potatoes in first?

No.
No?
Oh! Very confusing to me.

There's no potatoes in the pot,
and it's culinary-school basics

that you bring potatoes up
in cold water,

so the outside will be cooked
at the same time
as the inside.

What's the move
with the Brussels sprouts?

I was going to toss them
with a little bit of salt,

some lemon juice --
Lem-- No, no, no, no.

No lemon juice in
Brussels sprouts.
In Brussels sprouts?

It will turn them.
It'll turn them.

What are the chances
Jordan gets strangled today?

Tyler: I always put lemon juice
on my Brussels sprouts.
What are you doing, Khoi?

Khoi: So I'm reducing,
like, a coconut milk

with some sugar,
some fish sauce,
and that's gonna make it

the savory dessert
that I want.

Fish sauce for dessert.
Amazing.

Geez, man, this guy puts
fish sauce on everything.

You're taking a risk.
I am.

But you know what?
I really respect that.

Thank you.
I'm trying.
You know? Good job.

He's pretty much putting fish
sauce in every damn thing
that we cooking.
Now I'm really suspicious.
[ Banging pot ]
Yoo-hoo, oh, chefs.
Ludo: Chefs, listen up.

We have a very,
very important message.

I forgot to tell you
the name of this challenge.
Oh, no.

It is called
Station Ratation.

Will each team please leave
their TV dinner where it is

and rotate
one station over?
No!
